intro: Kohleria brachycalyx, commonly known as the short-calyx kohleria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically features dark green, glossy leaves and produces showy blooms in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Kohleria brachycalyx is often cultivated as a decorative indoor plant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
